com.xhive.util.interfaces
Interface XhiveFormatterIf

public interface XhiveFormatterIf

Formats an XSL-FO document into other formats. XSL-FO is the layout part of the XSL standard. For information on XSL-FO, refer to: The W3C XSL:FO specification, or to: The apache XSL:FO formatter (FOP)

Currently, only PDF output is supported. The PDF string output can, for example, be saved to files, or sent on the World Wide Web as output from a Web server.

PDF generation is based on an old implementation of FOP. You cannot use this interface to work directly with newer releases of FOP, use the FOP interface directly in such cases.

An instance of this interface can be acquired through com.xhive.XhiveDriverFactory.getDriver().getFormatter()

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Method Detail

formatAsPDF

java.lang.String formatAsPDF(Document foSource)
Generate a PDF document from an XML document that adheres to the XSL-FO specification.

Parameters:
foSource - an XSL-FO document. In the current implementation you have to remove the document from its library (using XhiveLibraryIf.removeChild) to prevent XhiveExceptions during formatting. The formatter does not accept that the document is part of a larger structure.
If you remove a document from a library for formatting, you must re-insert the document in the library after the formatting.
Returns:
The formatted PDF output (in String format).
Throws:
XhiveException.FORMAT_EXCEPTION - Raised if the document is not a correct XSL-FO document, or when the document is in a library.

formatAsPDF

java.lang.String formatAsPDF(DOMImplementation docCreator,
                             Document xmlSource,
                             Document xslSource)
Generate a PDF document from an XSL-FO document that is the result of a transformation of a source document with an XSLT transformation document.

This convenience method is provided because you usually start with an XML document with some markup, then create an XSL-FO document using style rules from an XSLT document, and generate PDF output from that.

Parameters:
docCreator - the DOM implementation used to create the XSL-FO document. A common way to get such a DOM implementation is by using a XhiveLibraryIf object.
xmlSource - an input XML document.
xslSource - an XSLT document that transforms XML source into an XSL-FO document.
Returns:
The formatted PDF output (in String format).
Throws:
XhiveException.FORMAT_EXCEPTION - Raised if the XSLT transformation fails, or when the the resulting document is not a proper XSL-FO document.

formatAsPDFToStream

void formatAsPDFToStream(Document foSource,
                         java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
Generate a PDF document from an XML document that adheres to the XSL-FO specification.

Parameters:
foSource - an XSL-FO document. In the current implementation you have to remove the document from its library (using XhiveLibraryIf.removeChild) to prevent XhiveExceptions during formatting. The formatter does not accept that the document is part of a larger structure.
If you remove a document from a library for formatting, you must re-insert the document in the library after the formatting.
outputStream - the stream to write the output to.
Throws:
XhiveException.FORMAT_EXCEPTION - Raised if the document is not a correct XSL-FO document, or when the document is in a library.

formatAsPDFToStream

void formatAsPDFToStream(DOMImplementation docCreator,
                         Node xmlSource,
                         Document xslSource,
                         java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
Generate a PDF document from an XSL-FO document that is the result of a transformation of a source document with an XSLT transformation document.

This convenience method is provided because you usually start with an XML document with some markup, then create an XSL-FO document using style rules from an XSLT document, and generate PDF output from that.

Parameters:
docCreator - the DOM implementation used to create the XSL-FO document. A common way to get such a DOM implementation is by using a XhiveLibraryIf object.
xmlSource - an input XML document.
xslSource - an XSLT document that transforms XML source into an XSL-FO document.
outputStream - the stream to write the output to.
Throws:
XhiveException.FORMAT_EXCEPTION - Raised if the XSLT transformation fails, or when the the resulting document is not a proper XSL-FO document.
